titles.title: A bill to amend section 224 and of the Social Security Act to permit an individual who is entitled both to disability insurance benefits and to other periodic benefits, and who is consequently subject to benefit reduction under that section, to lessen the amount of such reduction by taking into account certain noncovered earnings in the year of his or her disability and the five preceding years.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to Subcommittee on Social Security.

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 1/6/1987--Introduced. Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to permit an individual who is entitled to both disability insurance and to workers' compensation or other periodic benefits which reduce the disability benefit to lessen such reduction by taking into account certain noncovered earnings in the year of disability and the preceding five years.
